Key Arguments: The bill threatens freedom of speech by imposing penalties for opinions contrary to government views.
It aligns with a globalist agenda, similar to actions taken by other countries like Canada.
The bill is seen as a step towards establishing a socialist regime by erasing freedoms and controlling speech.
The government should not be the authority on deciding what is fact, as it undermines open debate and scientific inquiry.
Recent government actions during the pandemic are cited as examples of misinformation and censorship.
The bill could lead to authoritarian censorship similar to that of the Chinese Communist Party.
Notable Quotes: This proposed Bill has capacity to trample the freedom of speech of all Australians underfoot.
The suggestion that government administrations are the embodiment of truth and thus the authority on deciding what is 'fact' in the public (and private) sphere is beyond arrogant.
An effective way to counter 'disinformation' is by illuminating truth and supporting this with genuine evidence.
